title: The red carpet battle between the Venice Mostra and the Cannes Film Festival
summary: Cannes Film Festival General Delegate Thierry Frémaux and Venice Film Festival Artistic Director Alberto Barbera are engaged in a hushed but real confrontation. Their obsession is to attract the greatest films, the best directors and the most glamorous stars.

title: USA take their first Paralympic track golds
summary: The USA finished the day on Saturday with five golds and fifth in the table. China leads with 20 golds.

title: Harris says Trump 'disrespected sacred ground' at US military cemetery
summary: On Thursday, the US Army confirmed that a cemetery staff member had been pushed aside after asking Trump's team to stop filming in a burial section for those killed in recent wars, where photography is banned. The military condemned the incident as 'unfortunate.'

title: Israel's deadly raid in occupied West Bank continues as Gaza polio vaccine campaign begins
summary: The Israeli army said two Palestinians were killed overnight while preparing to carry out bombings in the occupied West Bank. The enclave's Health Ministry said a campaign to inoculate children in Gaza against polio and prevent the spread of the virus began on Saturday.

title: French left seek backing for Macron impeachment
summary: Radical left party La France Insoumise argues that it is not up to the president 'to do political horsetrading,' taking aim at Emmanuel Macron's efforts since July to find a prime minister who would not be immediately ousted in a confidence vote.

title: Trump signals support for recreational marijuana in Florida: 'This will happen'
summary: Trump described his support as a matter of fairness across state borders and of the disproportional impact arrest can have on people's lives. At the same time, he urged the adoption of laws against public cannabis use 'so we do not smell marijuana everywhere we go, like we do in many of the Democrat run cities.'

title: Forced marriages on the rise in Pakistan due to climate change
summary: More and more families who have lost their land to atypical monsoons are forcing their daughters, who are often very young, to marry in order to obtain a dowry and be able to feed the rest of the family.

title: In South Korea, the battle of the sexes is in full swing
summary: Tensions between men and women are on the rise in South Korean society. Advances in women's rights and their rejection of traditional hierarchies are facing resistance from a 'masculinist' fringe with varying degrees of support right up to the top echelons of the government.

title: Famous manga artists Masashi Kishimoto and Mikio Ikemoto meet adoring fans in Paris
summary: The creators of the popular ninja character Naruto and his son Boruto met French fans at the Grand Rex movie theater last weekend.

title: France's Dorian Foulon strikes Paralympic cycling gold
summary: In the final race of the day, Foulon had the French flags flying in the stands as he defended his C5 4000m individual pursuit title won at the Tokyo Games.

title: In Los Angeles, the Château Marmont, refuge for fallen angels
summary: This summer, 'M' passes through the doors of some of film's legendary hotels. In 2010, Sofia Coppola set up her cameras at the Chateau Marmont to shoot 'Somewhere,' a reflection of a certain Hollywood melancholy.

title: US and Iraq joint raid kills 15 IS members
summary: The joint operation by US and Iraqi forces in west Iraq comes as Baghdad and Washington have been engaged in months of talks over the presence of anti-jihadist coalition forces in the country.

title: UK's far right is splintered but capable of strong mobilization
summary: While no British far-right movement has managed to break through electorally, this summer's riots demonstrated the strong mobilizing power of far-right networks, and their potential for violence.

title: Brazil's Federal Supreme Court escalates tensions with Musk after suspending X
summary: Judge Alexandre de Moraes, who is in charge of the main investigations into former president Jair Bolsonaro, ordered the platform to delete certain accounts and accused it of facilitating the spread of fake news. Musk denounced the move as an obstacle to 'free speech.'

title: In the abyss, dragon fish make big eyes to better spot females
summary: Reproduction is a real challenge at extreme depths, as individuals are so rare. The eyeballs of males are larger, which is an exception among vertebrates.

title: Paralympic athlete Fleur Jong, a Dutch long jump superstar
summary: The 28-year-old Dutchwoman will defend her Paralympic long jump title on Saturday.

title: Belarus: How the country's innovative IT sector is trying to rebuild itself abroad
summary: Four years after the 2020 Belarusian protests and more than two years after the start of the war in Ukraine, computer scientists and engineers have gone into exile in Poland and the Baltic states, despite an increasingly hostile legal environment.

title: Mexico's President AMLO's judiciary reform bill paralyzes courts
summary: Mexican judges and court staff have been on indefinite strike against the judiciary reform of the outgoing president, who will have a qualified majority in Congress from September 1.

title: In the US, many cancers are becoming increasingly common in young people
summary: A major American study has determined that generations born in the 1980s and 1990s are more likely to develop cancer than their elders. However, these findings are not solely due to an aging population, but sometimes due to earlier diagnoses. Fortunately, the incidence of tobacco-related tumors is decreasing, unlike that of cancers linked to pollution and diet.

title: Houthi rebels say they attacked ship off Yemen
summary: The US Central Command said Saturday that US forces destroyed a Houthi drone and an uncrewed surface vessel in rebel-controlled areas of Yemen over the past 24 hours. 'It was determined these systems presented a clear and imminent threat to US and coalition forces,' CENTCOM said in a statement on X.
